1.name: Das Cabinet des Dr. Caligari
1.description: Hypnotist Dr. Caligari uses a somnambulist, Cesare, to commit murders.

2.name: Der Golem, wie er in die Welt kam
2.description: In 16th-century Prague, a rabbi creates the Golem - a giant creature made of clay. Using sorcery, he brings the creature to life in order to protect the Jews of Prague from persecution.

3.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
3.description: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

4.name: Way Down East
4.description: A naive country girl is tricked into a sham marriage by a wealthy womanizer, then must rebuild her life despite the taint of having borne a child out of wedlock.

5.name: Sex
5.description: A broadway actress uses her sex appeal to ruin a marriage only to dump her lover for a richer prospect.

6.name: Within Our Gates
6.description: Abandoned by her fiancé, an educated black woman with a shocking past dedicates herself to helping a near bankrupt school for impoverished black youths.

7.name: The Mark of Zorro
7.description: A seemingly idiotic fop is really the courageous vigilante Zorro, who seeks to protect the oppressed.

8.name: The Last of the Mohicans
8.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil...                See full summary »

9.name: The Symbol of the Unconquered
9.description: Racists learn that the land a negro owns lies over a vast oil field, and threaten his life when he refuses to sell.

10.name: Shakuntala
10.description: Raja Dushyanta is out hunting in a nearby forest happens upon an attractive maiden, named Shakuntala, and instantly falls in love with her. He gives Shakuntala his ring as a symbol of his ...                See full summary »

11.name: Der Januskopf
11.description: See everything in the book "Conrad Veidt on Screen" by John T. Soister (McFarland 2002), pages 109-113.

12.name: The Flapper
12.description: Ginger grows up in a slow town. Because of her wild attitude, her father decides to send her to a strict boarding school. Despite the strictness, the girls have fun getting into flapper lifestyle trouble including flirting.

13.name: The Penalty
13.description: A deformed criminal mastermind plans to loot the city of San Francisco as well as revenge himself on the doctor who mistakenly amputated his legs.

14.name: The Saphead
14.description: The simple-minded son of a rich financier must find his own way in the world.

15.name: Why Change Your Wife?
15.description: Robert and Beth Gordon are married but share little. He runs into Sally at a cabaret and the Gordons are soon divorced. Just as he gets bored with Sally's superficiality, Beth strives to ...                See full summary »

16.name: Genuine
16.description: Extremely rare work of Robert Wiene. From the director and year of excellent "The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari" this work was eventually overshadowed by the success of Caligari. It has a dreamy atmosphere, like another world or something.

17.name: Sumurun
17.description: The favorite slave girl of a tyrannical sheik falls in love with a cloth merchant. Meanwhile, a hunchback clown suffers unrequited love for a traveling dancer who wants to join the harem.

18.name: Der Ochsenkrieg
18.description: A power struggle between mountain peasants who have been raising milk cows on common land and a village bailiff trying to gain power driving them off the land. Both have a ducal documents that states the opposite.

19.name: Something to Think About
19.description: Wealthy cripple Markley finances the education of blacksmith's daughter Ruth. When she returns to their small town he asks to marry her, but she runs off with city worker Jim Dirk who is ...                See full summary »

20.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
20.description: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

21.name: Von morgens bis mitternachts
21.description: A Cashier in a bank in a small German town is alerted to the power of money by the visit of a rich Italian lady. He embezzles 60, 000 Marks and leaves for the capital city, where he ...                See full summary »

22.name: Blade af Satans bog
22.description: In 4 episodic tales of human suffering; the temptation of Jesus, the Spanish Inquisition, the French Revolution and the Russo-Finnish war of 1918, Satan attempts to win God's favor.

23.name: Prästänkan
23.description: A young man is elected by a small village to be its parson. As part of his duties, he is required to marry the widow of the parson before him. This poses two problems--first, the widow is ...                See full summary »

24.name: Pollyanna
24.description: An orphan's optimistic outlook brings a change to the ill-tempered town in which she resides to her aunt.

25.name: The Son of Tarzan
25.description: The scenario follows the book closely. Tarzan's son Jack (Korak to the apes) is kidnapped from England by Tarzan's old enemy Paulovich. He escapes into the African jungle with the help of ...                See full summary »

26.name: Erotikon
26.description: EROTIKON surely pushed the boundaries of what was acceptable on the screen in 1920: Irene, the bored wife of a distracted entomologist, pursues a womanizing aviator, but she may actually be...                See full summary »

27.name: Outside the Law
27.description: In this early collaboration with director Tod Browning (Dracula, Freaks), Chaney delivers a dual performance of dramatic intensity, starring as Ah Wing, a kind-hearted student of Confucian ...                See full summary »

28.name: Anna Boleyn
28.description: The story of the ill-fated second wife of the English king Henry VIII, whose marriage to the Henry led to momentous political and religious turmoil in England.

29.name: The Round-Up
29.description: An overweight sheriff does his best to assist a man accused of theft.

30.name: The Idol Dancer
30.description: This D.W Griffith silent classic features a new music score by writer composer, Jim Roberge.

31.name: Das wandernde Bild
31.description: Mia May has surrendered herself to a disciple of free love, and, having given birth to a child, marries the twin brother and Doppelgänger of her chosen lover.

32.name: The Man from Snowy River
32.description: A country boy, Jim Conroy, is living a dissolute life in the city, running around with vamp Helen Ross. When his father cuts him off, he is dumped by Helen and returns to the bush.

33.name: The Revenge of Tarzan
33.description: Tarzan and Jane are sailing for France in answer to a call for help from Countess de Coude who is being persecuted by her brother Rokoff. After a duel with the Countess' jealous husband, ...                See full summary »

34.name: Klostret i Sendomir
34.description: Two weary travelers come upon a monastery. While staying the night, they learn of its mysterious founding.

35.name: Headin' Home
35.description: The "true story" of baseball great Babe Ruth; Ruth plays himself.

36.name: Satanas
36.description: A three-part historical film, with episode one taking place in ancient Egypt, the second is based on the Hugo novel, and the third episode takes place during the 1917 Russian revolution.

38.name: The Devil's Passkey
38.description: The wife of an American playwright in Paris becomes ensnared in the seductive wiles of an American Army officer, but her devotion to her husband convinces the officer to try to extricate ...                See full summary »

39.name: Treasure Island
39.description: Young Jim Hawkins is caught up with the pirate Long John Silver in search of the buried treasure of the buccaneer Captain Flint, in this adaptation of the classic novel by Robert Louis ...                See full summary »

41.name: Der Richter von Zalamea
41.description: Spain at the beginning of the 1580s, at the time of Philip II. The troops of the king entered the village of Zalamea. Captain Don Alvaro is quartered in the house of Pedro Crespo and his ...                See full summary »

42.name: Huckleberry Finn
42.description: Huckleberry Finn, a rambuctious boy adventurer chafing under the bonds of civilization, escapes his humdrum world and his selfish, plotting father by sailing a raft down the Mississippi ...                See full summary »

43.name: Der Bucklige und die Tänzerin
43.description: Wilton, a hunchback, who was always scorned and ridiculed by women, returns from Java a rich man after having discovered a diamond mine. He romances Gina, who is on the rebound from a ...                See full summary »

44.name: Die Spinnen, 2. Teil - Das Brillantenschiff
44.description: Kay Hoog wants to stop the organisation "Die Spinnen" to get a certain diamond, that will give the owning woman the crown of Asia, but the man, who should be the owner of that diamond, ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Restless Sex
45.description: A young woman is torn between two men, her childhood sweetheart and a handsome art student.

46.name: The River's End
46.description: In the gold fields of the Canadian Northwest, a man is falsely accused of a crime and determines that a lookalike is responsible.

49.name: The Mollycoddle
49.description: An American who has lived much of his life outside the country returns to Arizona for the first time in years and encounters villainy.

50.name: Mästerman
50.description: A pawnbroker, widely despised, called Mästerman is the subject of tales of terror and cruelty. In his profession, he is merciless.
